<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                   <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#ac12e6a8f3a1b511f0dee2ed6de0ae806">cl::init</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">), <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl/#a68075925a54790e71ca790e1d4f21a40a263ac008d8d31f13ce460395fc4cf7e6">cl::Hidden</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Print out the IR after passes, similar to -print-after-all except that it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// only prints the IR after passes that change the IR. Those passes that do not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// make changes to the IR are reported as not making any changes. In addition,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the initial IR is also reported.  Other hidden options affect the output from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// this option. -filter-passes will limit the output to the named passes that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// actually change the IR and other passes are reported as filtered out. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// specified passes will either be reported as making no changes (with no IR</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// reported) or the changed IR will be reported. Also, the -filter-print-funcs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// and -print-module-scope options will do similar filtering based on function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// name, reporting changed IRs as functions(or modules if -print-module-scope is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// specified) for a particular function or indicating that the IR has been</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// filtered out. The extra options can be combined, allowing only changed IRs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for certain passes on certain functions to be reported in different formats,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with the rest being reported as filtered out.  The -print-before-changed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// option will print the IR as it was before each pass that changed it. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// optional value of quiet will only report when the IR changes, suppressing all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// other messages, including the initial IR. The values &quot;diff&quot; and &quot;diff-quiet&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// will present the changes in a form similar to a patch, in either verbose or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// quiet mode, respectively. The lines that are removed and added are prefixed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with &#39;-&#39; and &#39;+&#39;, respectively. The -filter-print-funcs and -filter-passes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// can be used to filter the output.  This reporter relies on the linux diff</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// utility to do comparisons and insert the prefixes. For systems that do not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// have the necessary facilities, the error message will be shown in place of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the expected output.</span></CodeLine>
